intro: Cheiridopsis resurgens, commonly known as the Resurgent Ice Plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with blue-green foliage that turns reddish under stress. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems.
